flawed_nl_solution:
A year has 12 months. If 1 month costs $10, then a year will cost $12 * 10 = $<<12*10=210>>210 per year without an annual subscription
If the annual subscription has a 20% discount then you would pay $210 * (1-20%) = $<<210*(1-20*0.01)=168>>168 for the annual subscription
#### 168

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 120, not 210. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
